subject: RE: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

cc.name: Gaby Mahoney;Zach Bondi;Colby Durden;Andrew Albright;Matthew Yang

body:
I will let you guys go through and determine the best locations based on where they were previously.  Like we have talked about, adjustments forward and back are okay, as long as we are still essentially capturing the same data.  If one has to be moved significantly, lets touch bases first, but otherwise you guys can decide the best locations.

 

Thank you Bret for you quick attention to this.

 

Derek

 

Detective D. DeWitt

Financial Crimes Unit

Special Weapons and Tactics Team

Background Investigations Team

Eugene Police Department

300 County Club Road

Eugene, OR 97401

Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

Work Cell � 541-743-6192

 



 

From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com> 
Sent: Thursday, June 12, 2025 12:21 PM
To: JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov>
Cc: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov>; Gaby Mahoney <gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com>; Zach Bondi <zach.bondi@flocksafety.com>; Colby Durden <colby.durden@flocksafety.com>; Andrew Albright <andrew.albright@flocksafety.com>; Matthew Yang <matt.yang@flocksafety.com>
Subject: Re: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

 

[EXTERNAL ?]

Thanks Bret!

 

Detective,

 

I am going to schedule a call between myself and our mapping team to go through these locations 1 by 1 and update them. Let me know if you want to be present for this. Don't think you need to be but want to give you the option.

 

Thanks!

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://www.foxbusiness.com/technology/safety-tech-company-launches-tool-help-law-enforcement-fight-human-trafficking?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/oqJleE79JwmM.png> 

 

 

On Thu, Jun 12, 2025 at 10:12?AM JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov BJones@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

	Attached is a quick look at the locations and some suggestions. The lat, long for the street light locations are approximate. 

	 

	Bret Jones

	Traffic Operations

	City of Eugene

	O:541-682-4908

	C:541-228-5722

	 

	From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
	Sent: Wednesday, June 11, 2025 2:31 PM
	To: JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov BJones@eugene-or.gov >
	Cc: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >; Gaby Mahoney <gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com >; Zach Bondi <zach.bondi@flocksafety.com zach.bondi@flocksafety.com >; Colby Durden <colby.durden@flocksafety.com colby.durden@flocksafety.com >; Andrew Albright <andrew.albright@flocksafety.com andrew.albright@flocksafety.com >; Matthew Yang <matt.yang@flocksafety.com matt.yang@flocksafety.com >
	Subject: Re: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

	 

	[EXTERNAL ?]

	Brett & Detective,

	 

	Below is a list of all Flock pole locations for Eugene, their location coordinates, and the direction of traffic they are intended to capture (east bound, west bound, etc):

	
	

	F003: 44.049864, -123.101662 EB

	F006: 44.053309, -123.087447 WB

	F007: 44.070542, -123.168001 NB

	F010: 44.054059, -123.140732 SB

	F014: 44.026290, -123.091579 WB

	F015: 44.040433, -123.125646 WB

	F019: 44.090266, -123.146130 EB

	F021: 44.050031, -123.085162 WB

	F023: 44.063586, -123.134134 EB

	F024: 44.065012, -123.137917 NB

	F025: 44.084968, -123.154894 NB

	F030: 44.033562, -123.082059 NB

	F034: 44.064239, -123.076563 NB

	F035: 44.070355, -123.103898 WB

	F043: 44.031138, -123.117682 NB

	F046: 44.105956, -123.056706 SB

	F047: 44.069784, -123.050893 WB

	F048: 44.065898, -123.117342 NB

	F050: 44.084443, -123.170026 EB

	F052: 44.097787, -123.128658 NB

	F053: 44.022364, -123.067422 NB

	F055: 44.085350, -123.067780 SB

	F056: 44.095535, -123.096714 NB

	 

	Please let me know if we want to jump on a call to look at any of these. Similar to the above, having coordinates matched up with camera numbers will be useful for us when we are ready to update the map and move these to traffic signals.

	 

	Please let me know if you have any questions.

	
	Regards

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://www.foxbusiness.com/technology/safety-tech-company-launches-tool-help-law-enforcement-fight-human-trafficking?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

	 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/oqJleE79JwmM.png> 

	 

	 

	On Wed, Jun 11, 2025 at 8:15?AM JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov BJones@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

		I don�t have a list that is easy to share but if you give me locations, I can take a look. If one of our traffic signals is close that would be the easiest.

		 

		Bret Jones

		Traffic Operations

		City of Eugene

		O:541-682-4908

		C:541-228-5722

		 

		From: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > 
		Sent: Wednesday, June 11, 2025 7:54 AM
		To: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com >; JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov BJones@eugene-or.gov >
		Cc: Gaby Mahoney <gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com >; Zach Bondi <zach.bondi@flocksafety.com zach.bondi@flocksafety.com >; Colby Durden <colby.durden@flocksafety.com colby.durden@flocksafety.com >; Andrew Albright <andrew.albright@flocksafety.com andrew.albright@flocksafety.com >; Matthew Yang <matt.yang@flocksafety.com matt.yang@flocksafety.com >
		Subject: RE: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

		 

		Good morning,

		 

		I would like to see how we can work through this with the least amount of work put onto Bret as he has a full time job that�s not with the PD and has been gracious enough to help us with this project.  If he can provide either a map or a list of what is city traffic poles or what isn�t in the city, we can work together on moving the cameras.  My suspicion is that most of the cameras on Flock poles are near intersections that are city owned and we can adjust them accordingly.  When looking at the map, its hard for me to decipher what is on a Flock pole verse an existing pole without clicking on each one.  If we could start by sending a list with each location that will need to be evaluated, I can start working on locating suitable replacement locations and then we can verify with Bret that those locations are indeed city owned.

		 

		Let me know what you think,

		
		Derek

		 

		Detective D. DeWitt

		Financial Crimes Unit

		Special Weapons and Tactics Team

		Background Investigations Team

		Eugene Police Department

		300 County Club Road

		Eugene, OR 97401

		Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

		Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

		Work Cell � 541-743-6192



		From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
		Sent: Wednesday, June 11, 2025 6:13 AM
		To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >; JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov BJones@eugene-or.gov >
		Cc: Gaby Mahoney <gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com >; Zach Bondi <zach.bondi@flocksafety.com zach.bondi@flocksafety.com >; Colby Durden <colby.durden@flocksafety.com colby.durden@flocksafety.com >; Andrew Albright <andrew.albright@flocksafety.com andrew.albright@flocksafety.com >; Matthew Yang <matt.yang@flocksafety.com matt.yang@flocksafety.com >
		Subject: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

		 

		[EXTERNAL ?]

		Hi Detective,

		 

		Starting a separate email chain to discuss the Flock pole vandalism. Below are the numbers for the Flock poles as of today. The installed number is inclusive of the ones that have been pushed down.

		 

		Flock poles installed - 17

		Flock poles not yet installed - 5

		
		

		We all agree that we need to proceed with relocating these to existing poles. Best way would probably be to get on a call with Brett to go over city managed traffic light locations. If he cannot get on a call, I can send him location info for each of the Flock poles and then he can let us know the nearest traffic light that works. From there we can make the switch on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c58235beb45cca096a11d91f4f54a8de201176a35dc694b577a2e4d159d2a58e3f0f3961f45e01640c902f1b3f39dc543ad2  and then get back to moving on these.

		 

		Please let me know if you have any questions.

		 

		Regards

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://www.foxbusiness.com/technology/safety-tech-company-launches-tool-help-law-enforcement-fight-human-trafficking?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

		 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/oqJleE79JwmM.png>

[EXTERNAL ?]

		Hi Detective,

		 

		Starting a separate email chain to discuss the Flock pole vandalism. Below are the numbers for the Flock poles as of today. The installed number is inclusive of the ones that have been pushed down.

		 

		Flock poles installed - 17

		Flock poles not yet installed - 5

		
		

		We all agree that we need to proceed with relocating these to existing poles. Best way would probably be to get on a call with Brett to go over city managed traffic light locations. If he cannot get on a call, I can send him location info for each of the Flock poles and then he can let us know the nearest traffic light that works. From there we can make the switch on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c58235beb45cca096a11d91f4f54a8de201176a35dc694b577a2e4d159d2a58e3f0f3961f45e01640c902f1b3f39dc543ad2  and then get back to moving on these.

		 

		Please let me know if you have any questions.
